How to play

This is digitalized version of well-known boardgame "Battleships". As it has many variations to the rules, here are some that I decided to go with.

  • Ships:
    • Each player has 5 sips: Aircraft Carrier (Size 5), Battleship (Size 4), Crusier (Size 3), Submarine (Size 3), Destroyer (Size 2)
    • Ships can only be placed horizontally or vertically (no diagonal placement)
    • Ships cannot be placed adjacent to each other
  • Game:
    • The game starts with ships placement, players can do it manually, or let the game place them randomly
    • Each player has one shot in turn, regardless of whether they hit a ship, sunk it or not
    • Each cell can only be shot at once, you do not lose your turn when you try to shoot at a cell that has already been shot at
    • In hotseat mode, between players' turns, there is a "blindfold" screen allowing players to change places fairly. Player change is completed, when the next player inputs "ready" on the "blindfold" screen
    • In the game against AI, AI's turn happens automatically without showing its board
    • The game ends when all of one player's ships had been sunk
  • The how to's:
    • To start the game, in main menu select gamemode you want to play
    • If you choose "Play against AI" select AI's difficulty level
    • Choose whether you want to place your ships on board manually, or let the game randomly choose thier locatioin for you (Repeat this step for second player in hotseat mode)
    • If you choose to place your ships manually, place them in descending order sorter by thier sizes, by inputing thier coordinates seperated by spaces in given format [DIR COL ROW] where:
      • DIR - direction of the sihp:
        • | (pipe) - ship will be placed vertically downwards from [COL ROW] coordinates
        • - (minus) - ship will be placed horizontally to the right from [COL ROW] coordinates
      • COL - column in which ship will be placed [A - J]
      • ROW - row in which ship will be placed [1 - 10]
    • Take your turn: take a shot at any coordinates that have not been shot at yet (cells that have been shot at are indicated by "â€¢" in them)
    • Surrender your turn to the opponent, and play untill all of your or your opponents ships have been sunk
